00037 RDK2_FACTORY(ModuleConfig);
00038 
00039 void ModuleConfig::read(Reader*r) throw (ReadingException)
00040 {
00041     unsigned char vers = r->startReading("ModuleConfig");
00042     moduleName = r->readString("moduleName");
00043     library = r->readString("library");
00044     if (vers == 1) r->readString("configFile");
00045     if (vers > 1) r->readObject(&visualConfigPosition, "visualConfigPosition");
00046     else visualConfigPosition = RPoint2i(0, 0);
00047     string textConfig = r->readString("textConfig");
00048     parseTextConfig(textConfig);
00049     if (vers == 1) r->readObject(&objConfigs, "config");
00050     else r->readObject(&objConfigs, "objConfigs");
00051     r->doneReading();
00052 }
00053 
00054 void ModuleConfig::write(Writer*w) const throw (WritingException)
00055 {
00056     w->startWriting("ModuleConfig", 2);
00057     w->writeString(moduleName, "moduleName");
00058     w->writeString(library, "library");
00059     w->writeObject(true, &visualConfigPosition, "visualConfigPosition");
00060     string textConfig = prepareTextConfigForSave();
00061     w->writeString(textConfig, "textConfig");
00062     w->writeObject(true, &objConfigs, "objConfigs");
00063     w->doneWriting();
00064 }
00065 
00066 vector<string> stripOptionsFromTextConfigValue(string& val)
00067 {
00068     string newVal = val;
00069     size_t a = val.find_first_of("[");
00070     size_t b = val.find_last_of("]");
00071     if (a == string::npos) return vector<string>();
00072     else {
00073         if (b == string::npos) {
00074             RDK_ERROR_PRINTF("Malformed text configuration value '%s'", val.c_str());
00075             return vector<string>();
00076         }
00077         else {
00078             string z = val.substr(a+1, b-a-1);
00079             newVal = trim(val.substr(0, a));
00080             vector<string> v = tokenize(z, ",");
00081             for (size_t i = 0; i < v.size(); i++) v[i] = trim(v[i]);
00082             val = newVal;
00083             return v;
00084         }
00085     }
00086 }
00087 
00088 // *** OPTIONS ***
00089 //
00090 // all:
00091 // KEEP[_THIS]      keep this value, don't save a new value (i.e.: load but not save)
00092 // VOLATILE         do not save anything of this object (it will be the default, i.e.: don't load nor save)
00093 // PERSISTENT       default (load and save)
00094 //
00095 // for remote edit:
00096 // NOT_EDITABLE     this property can be modified only by the owner module
00097 // EDITABLE         this property can be modified by remote and rconsole
00098 //
00099 // external links (value begins with '@'):
00100 // TCP[_IP], UDP[_IP], SHM
00101 //                  how to do the external link (if external)
00102 // ON_CHANGE[(x)], PERIODIC[(x)]
00103 //                  broadcast on change (maximum times per seconds) or periodically (seconds)
00104 // DIFF[S], VALUE   send the diff or the whole value
00105 //
00106 // external files (value begins with '$'):
00107 // BIN[ARY]         the file is binary saved
00108 // XML              the file is xml saved (default)
00109 
00110 void ModuleConfig::parseTextConfig(cstr textConfig)
00111 {
00112     // load text configurations in the textObjConfigs map
00113     textObjConfigs.clear();
00114     istringstream ifs(textConfig);
00115     string line;
00116     while (getline(ifs, line)) {
00117         vector<string> vv = tokenize(line, "#");
00118         if (vv.size() > 0) {
00119             line = vv[0];
00120             vv = tokenize(line, "=");
00121             if (vv.size() > 0) {
00122                 string key = trim(vv[0]);
00123                 if (key != "") {
00124                     string val = (vv.size() == 1 ? "" : trim(vv[1]));
00125                     textObjConfigs.insert(make_pair(key, val));
00126                 }
00127             }
00128         }
00129     }
00130 
00131     for (map<string, string>::iterator it = textObjConfigs.begin();
00132     it != textObjConfigs.end(); ++it) {
00133         // get options between square brackets and strip them from property value
00134         vector<string> opts = stripOptionsFromTextConfigValue(it->second);
00135         //RDK_DEBUG_PRINTF("value stripped: '%s'", it->second.c_str());
00136         // put options in userOptions map
00137         for (vector<string>::iterator optIt = opts.begin(); optIt != opts.end(); ++optIt) {
00138             string opt = *optIt;
00139             if (opt == "KEEP") opt = "KEEP_THIS";
00140             else if (opt == "BIN") opt = "BINARY";
00141             //RDK_DEBUG_PRINTF("  option: '%s'", opt.c_str());
00142             userOptions[it->first].insert(opt);
00143         }
00144     }
00145 }
00146 
00147 #define COMMENT_COLUMN 45
00148 
00149 string ModuleConfig::prepareTextConfigForSave() const
00150 {
00151     string tc;
00152     for (map<string, string>::const_iterator it = textObjConfigs.begin();
00153     it != textObjConfigs.end(); ++it) {
00154         string pname = it->first, opts, val = it->second;
00155         bool commented = false;
00156         if (pname[0] == '#') { commented = true; pname = pname.substr(1); }
00157         
00158         map<string, set<string> >::const_iterator uoIt = userOptions.find(pname);
00159         if (uoIt != userOptions.end()) {
00160             const set<string>& propUserOpts = uoIt->second;
00161             for (set<string>::iterator it = propUserOpts.begin();
00162             it != propUserOpts.end(); ++it) {
00163                 opts += *it + ",";
00164             }
00165             
00166             if (opts.size() > 0) {
00167                 opts = "[" + opts.substr(0, opts.size() - 1) + "]";
00168                 commented = false;
00169             }
00170         }
00171         
00172         string line = (commented? "#" : "") + pname + "=" + val + opts;
00173         int spc = COMMENT_COLUMN - line.size();
00174         if (spc < 1) spc = 1;
00175         string desc;
00176         map<string, string>::const_iterator descIt = descriptions.find(pname);
00177         if (descIt != descriptions.end()) desc = descIt->second;
00178         tc += string(8, ' ') + line + string(spc, ' ') + "# " + desc + "\n";
00179     }
00180     return "\n" + tc + string(6, ' ');
00181 }
